metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4492 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the XMLHttpRequest::Open implementation in Mozilla Firefox before 40.0 and Firefox ESR 38.x before 38.2 might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a SharedWorker object that makes recursive calls to the open method of an XMLHttpRequest object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
